metadata.title: CVE-2022-36879 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.18.14.xfrm_expand_policies in net/xfrm/xfrm_policy.c can cause a refcount to bedropped twice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36879` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-128-generic - 5.4.0-128.144
linux-image-5.4.0-128-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-128.144
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-128-generic - 5.4.0-128.144
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-128-lowlatency - 5.4.0-128.144
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-50-generic - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-50-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-50.56~20.04.1
